feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Daily Wage Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days, requiring manual interventions for overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation.

known_issues.group_title: Payroll Formula Override in Leave Policy
known_issues.title: Daily Wage Formula Discrepancy Between Leave and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy shows a greyed-out formula that is intentionally replaced by the payroll settings configuration. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses specific methodologies for counting days, accounting for leap years, and applying different daily rates based on service duration.
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparent calculation breakdown for end-of-service gratuity | Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Worked Calculation in Gratuity
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. The system uses a fixed 30-day divisor for daily wage, which may not align with all client calculation preferences.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation shows minor inconsistency in total days counted
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential precision issue in days worked calculation and daily wage computation method

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. User believed daily wage should be divided by 31 days, but system used 30 days based on policy settings, resulting in salary difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary month-to-month due to different working day counts
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a unified daily wage calculation method, but the current system uses separate configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations use different divisors and configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood salary proration calculation. The system correctly calculates based on working days defined in the employee's work week configuration. In this specific case, the NVK Operations work week has all 7 days configured as working days, resulting in a full 31-day working month calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of prorating based on actual working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in daily wage calculator's ability to handle dynamic proration scenarios, particularly for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: Public holiday additions after leave request creation cause mismatches in daily wage calculations between HR and Payroll systems, resulting in incorrect salary deductions. The Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to the Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across different system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct. This creates potential user confusion about the daily rate calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Remarks field shows incorrect days for month calculations, specifically for February in leap years
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on actual days in each month

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. The calculation uses gross salary instead of basic salary, contrary to the configured leave policy (Basic Salary / Working Days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display Across Payroll Months
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic recalculates rates based on payroll processing month instead of storing the rate from original leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Requires manual tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves

limitations.title: Payroll Daily Wage Calculator Overrides Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings automatically overrides the formula in the leave policy. The leave policy formula is displayed as greyed out to indicate it will not be used.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculations in payroll settings to ensure correct unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations consistently produce amounts less than expected by small decimal points when computing pro-rated salary for partial months.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in end-of-service settlements

limitations.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at month-end, meaning incomplete months are not automatically included in end-of-service calculations
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month will not have current month's leave days automatically included in final settlement

limitations.title: Service Duration Calculation Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculation

limitations.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
limitations.limitation_statement: For service periods above 5 years, the system uses nuanced day counting that differs from manual calculations, including special handling for leap years by using 366 as a divisor when applicable.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies for employees with service periods spanning partial years

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational needs

limitations.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage divisor is fixed in policy configuration and does not automatically adjust based on month length or specific employee scenarios.

limitations.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment calculations are based on working days, which varies monthly (e.g., 20 working days in February)
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ across months due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between leave salary and salary proration

limitations.title: Salary Proration Tied to Work Week Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based strictly on the configured work week, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculations may differ from traditional calendar-based expectations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, failing for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot reliably manage payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to remove.

limitations.title: Working Days Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Salary deductions for unpaid leave depend on precise working days calculation

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations use actual calendar days for the specific month, with special handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years)
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate pro-rata calculations for unpaid leave across different months

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inability to automatically adjust salary based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks automated attendance-based salary calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage formula display between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings are designed to take precedence for unpaid leave calculations, with leave policy formula intentionally greyed out
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and configure daily wage calculator in payroll settings to ensure correct unpaid leave deductions

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect unpaid leave deduction amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the leave request and recreate it if deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect gratuity amount due to leap year miscalculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses fixed 365-day year instead of recognizing 366 days in leap years
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust calculation to use 366 days for leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect pro-rated amount showing less than expected
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Systematic decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and potentially adjust final settlement amounts

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance and gratuity calculation limitations for mid-month departures
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System follows strict monthly accrual policy that does not automatically prorate incomplete months
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust EOS balance in the system or switch to conditional daily accrual policy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in total service days calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Unclear rules about counting departure date and handling leap year days in service duration calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify service days calculation, particularly for leap years and departure date inclusion

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Differences between manual and system gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses precise day counting method, including specific handling for partial years and leap years, which may differ from manual calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculation by breaking down service period into segments, accounting for full years and partial years separately

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Difference in daily wage calculation between platform and client expectations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Platform uses fixed (Basic/30) method, while client prefers (Basic × 12 / 365)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual verification of gratuity calculations may be necessary to reconcile differences

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in leave salary amount for partial month leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Leave salary is calculated based on daily rate configuration in the leave policy, with a fixed divisor that may not match user expectations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand the system's calculation logic before submitting leave requests

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected variations in leave salary accrual totals
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, causing monthly calculation variations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Switch to 'custom days' setting for more consistent leave encashment calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and system-calculated leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or use consistent divisor across calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Apparent discrepancy in salary proration calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week policy to confirm working days setup

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Salary not prorated correctly for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic fails to handle departure dates relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary using daily rate: (Monthly Salary / 30) * Days Worked

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Payroll deductions remain after deleting leave request

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually remove duplicate deductions through payroll system backend

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect unpaid leave salary deduction

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected salary deductions during unpaid leave

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate settings and understand their precedence over policy-level configurations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System recalculates daily rate based on payroll processing month instead of storing original rate
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: A fix was deployed to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Formula Discrepancy Between Leave and Payroll
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy shows a greyed-out formula that is intentionally replaced by the payroll settings configuration. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Year
claims_to_validate.statement: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses specific methodologies for counting days, accounting for leap years, and applying different daily rates based on service duration.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Days Worked Calculation in Gratuity
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. The system uses a fixed 30-day divisor for daily wage, which may not align with all client calculation preferences.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. User believed daily wage should be divided by 31 days, but system used 30 days based on policy settings, resulting in salary difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a unified daily wage calculation method, but the current system uses separate configurations.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood salary proration calculation. The system correctly calculates based on working days defined in the employee's work week configuration. In this specific case, the NVK Operations work week has all 7 days configured as working days, resulting in a full 31-day working month calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of prorating based on actual working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: Public holiday additions after leave request creation cause mismatches in daily wage calculations between HR and Payroll systems, resulting in incorrect salary deductions. The Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to the Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct. This creates potential user confusion about the daily rate calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. The calculation uses gross salary instead of basic salary, contrary to the configured leave policy (Basic Salary / Working Days).

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display Across Payroll Months
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Daily Wage Calculator Overrides Leave Policy
claims_to_validate.statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings automatically overrides the formula in the leave policy. The leave policy formula is displayed as greyed out to indicate it will not be used.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations consistently produce amounts less than expected by small decimal points when computing pro-rated salary for partial months.

claims_to_validate.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at month-end, meaning incomplete months are not automatically included in end-of-service calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Service Duration Calculation Rules
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated

claims_to_validate.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
claims_to_validate.statement: For service periods above 5 years, the system uses nuanced day counting that differs from manual calculations, including special handling for leap years by using 366 as a divisor when applicable.

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage divisor is fixed in policy configuration and does not automatically adjust based on month length or specific employee scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment calculations are based on working days, which varies monthly (e.g., 20 working days in February)

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Proration Tied to Work Week Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based strictly on the configured work week, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, failing for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot reliably manage payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations use actual calendar days for the specific month, with special handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years)

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
